articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday criticized Israel's prosecutors over an ongoing corruption trial against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, saying it was interfering with his ability to conduct talks with both Hamas and Iran.
articles.title: Trump slams Israel's prosecutors over Netanyahu corruption trial

articles.author: Sara Rossi, Gavin Jones
articles.description: Mass tourism, impossibly high rents, worker exploitation, inequality and elitism: Venice protests in recent days against Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's high-profile wedding have highlighted growing global grievances.
articles.title: Venice protests target Bezos over mounting grievances

articles.author: Anita Komuves
articles.description: The annual event symbolizes the years-long struggle between Hungary's nationalist government and civil society.
articles.title: Tens of thousands march against Hungary's government, for LGBT rights

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of students and anti-corruption protesters rallied in Belgrade on Saturday, demanding snap elections and an end to the 12-year rule of President Aleksandar Vucic.
articles.title: Serbia's students, opposition rally to demand snap elections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top commander said on Saturday that his forces faced a new onslaught against a key city on the eastern front of its war against Russia, while Moscow said it was making progress in another sector farther southwest.
articles.title: Top Ukrainian commander sees new assault on key eastern city

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India's ministry of external affairs said on Sunday it rejects a statement by the Pakistan Army seeking to blame India for Saturday's attack in Waziristan.
articles.title: India rejects statement by Pakistan seeking to blame it for Waziristan attack

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court's landmark ruling blunting a potent weapon that federal judges have used to block government policies nationwide during legal challenges was in many ways a victory for President Donald Trump, except perhaps on the very policy he is seeking to enforce.
articles.title: Trump wins as Supreme Court curbs judges, but may yet lose on birthright citizenship

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A magnitude 5.5 earthquake struck central Pakistan, the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) said on Sunday.
articles.title: Magnitude 5.5 earthquake strikes central Pakistan,  GFZ says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 16 scientists and 10 senior commanders were among those mourned at the funeral, according to state media, including armed forces chief Major General Mohammad Bagheri and Revolutionary Guards commander General Hossein Salami.
articles.title: Iran holds funeral for top military commanders and scientists killed by Israel

articles.author: Jan Wolfe, Will Dunham
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court on the last day of rulings for its current term gave Donald Trump his latest in a series of victories at the nation's top judicial body, one that may make it easier for him to implement contentious elements of his sweeping agenda as he tests the limits of presidential power.
articles.title: Trump victorious again as US Supreme Court wraps up its term
